intro: Bupleurum asperuloides var. strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
